On this page, you will find the information on how to reflash Reach firmware.

Note that you **do not** need to do this unless you want to bring Reach to its initial state as all the data are erased during the reflashing procedure.

!!! tip ""
	Most new features are released via ReachView app and can be updated simply via its interface. More information on how to update ReachView app is available in [introduction section](../../reachview/#updating).

## Reach Firmware Flash Tool installation

!!! note "" 
	In the meantime, please use **Windows** or **Linux** operating systems to flash your Reach devices. Flash Tool for **Mac OS X** is coming soon.
	
* Get the Reach Firmware Flash Tool:

<center>
	
|Windows|Linux|
|:-------------:|:----------:|
|[Download [EXE, 85.9 MB]](http://files.emlid.com/flash-tools/win/reach-firmware-flash-tool_1.2.1_setup.exe)|[Download [DEB, 109.8 MB]](http://files.emlid.com/flash-tools/linux/reach-firmware-flash-tool_1.2.1_amd64.deb)|

</center>

### Windows installation

* Double click on the downloaded file
	
* Follow the instructions to install Reach Firmware Flash Tool on your PC

{%if model == 'RS/RS+'%} 
* For Reach RS, install the [Intel Edison Driver](http://files.emlid.com/firmware-reflashing-tool/IntelEdisonDriverSetup1.2.1.exe)
{%endif%}

{% if model == 'RTK'%}
* Install the [Intel Edison Driver](http://files.emlid.com/firmware-reflashing-tool/IntelEdisonDriverSetup1.2.1.exe)
{%endif%}

* Reboot your PC

### Linux installation

We recommend using the terminal to install the Flash Tool on your Linux PC. Follow these steps to accomplish it:

* Press `Ctrl+Alt+T` to open the terminal
* Navigate to the directory with the downloaded file with `cd ~/Downloads` command
* Run `sudo dpkg -i reach-firmware-flash-tool_1.2.0_amd64.deb` to start installation

!!! danger ""
	Please confirm adding the current user to `plugdev`, `dialout` and `lpadmin` groups during the installation process. In case of a negative answer, the application might not work as expected.

* Reboot your PC

## Firmware Flash Guide for Reach {{model}}

Get the latest ReachView image version and unzip it:

{%if model == 'RS2'%}

<center>

| For Reach RS2 |
|:-----------:|
| [**Reach RS2 Image v2.22.0 [ZIP, 360.5 MB]**](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-rs2-v2.22.0.zip), [(md5)](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-rs2-MD5SUMS)     |

</center>
{%endif%}

{%if model == 'RS/RS+'%}

<center>
	
|For Reach RS+|For Reach RS|
|:-------------:|:----------:|
|[**Reach RS+ Image v2.22.0 [ZIP, 376 MB]**](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-plus-v2.22.0.zip), [(md5)](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-plus-MD5SUMS)|[**Reach RS Image v2.22.0 [ZIP, 191.8 MB]**](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-rs-v2.22.0.zip), [(md5)](http://files.emlid.com/images/reachview-MD5SUMS)|

</center>
{%endif%}

{%if model == 'M+'%}

<center>

| For Reach M+ |
|:-----------:|
| [**Reach M+ Image v2.22.0 [ZIP, 376 MB]**](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-plus-v2.22.0.zip), [(md5)](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-plus-MD5SUMS)     |

</center>

{%endif%}

{%if model == 'RTK'%}

<center>

| For Reach RTK |
|:-----------:|
| [**Reach RTK Image v2.22.0 [ZIP, 191.8 MB]**](http://files.emlid.com/images/reach-rs-v2.22.0.zip), [(md5)](http://files.emlid.com/images/reachview-MD5SUMS)     |

</center>

{%endif%}

### Flashing process

* Open Reach Firmware Flash Tool and choose Reach {{model}}

<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/common/app-step1-device-select.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

{%if model == 'RS2' or model == 'M+'%}
* Connect Reach in Firmware Update mode:

??? note "Steps for Reach {{model}}"

    * Make sure that **Reach {{model}}** is turned off
			
    * Press and hold the power button
			
	* Plug the USB cable into PC

	* Release the power button

	* All LEDs should blink several times simultaneously, and then start blinking one after another
    <br> <p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/{{model_path}}/connect_fel.webp" style="width: 400px;" /></p>

{%endif%}
{%if model == 'RS/RS+'%}

??? note "Connect Reach RS+ in Firmware Update mode"
			
	* Make sure that **Reach RS+** is turned off

	* Press and hold the power button
			
	* Plug the USB cable into PC

	* Release the power button

	* All LEDs should blink several times simultaneously, and then start blinking one after another 
	<br> <p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/reachrs/connect_fel.webp" style="width: 400px;" /></p>

??? note "Connect Reach RS"

	* Connect Reach RS

	* Follow the instructions
	<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/reachrs/app-step2-connect-rs.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

	??? danger " "Not suitable USB port" error"
		If you face "USB port not suitable for flashing" error, disconnect Reach, turn it off and try another USB port.
		<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/common/app-step2-choose-usb-rs.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

{%endif%}

{%if model == 'RTK'%}

* Connect Reach {{model}}. Follow the instructions to your device

<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/reachrs/app-step2-connect-rs.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

??? danger ""Not suitable USB port" error" 
	If you face "USB port not suitable for flashing" error, disconnect Reach, turn it off and try another USB port.
	<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/common/app-step2-choose-usb-rs.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>
{%endif%}

* Select ReachView firmware .img file and click on _Flash_
	
<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/reachrs2/app-step3-select-firmware-rs2.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

* Wait until the end of the flashing process

<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/reachrs2/app-step4-flashing-rs2.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

* After reflashing, Reach will reboot

!!! danger ""
    Do not unplug the Reach on this step.

<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/reachrs2/app-step5-rebooting-rs2.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

* When Reach successfully reboots, you'll see "Reach is flashed and ready to use" message

<p style="text-align:center" ><img src="../img/reachview/firmware-reflashing/reachrs2/app-step5-flashed-rs2.png" style="width: 300px;" /></p>

## After flashing

Proceed to Quickstart section to set up your Reach device:

* [First Setup for Reach {{model}}](../../quickstart/first-setup/)
